Sampling from a sample set.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1432669"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1432669#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1421718" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1421718" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BlueMoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BlueMoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1421718ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1421718" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683">BlueMoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-03">10/03/21 21:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>PEPPERED ROSE<br />
<br />
One of the better Rose fragrances for men. Especially if you enjoy a more subtle, restrained rose that can be worn during the day, even to the office. It has that kind of versatility. <br />
<br />
Another nice offering, Penhaligon.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1421718"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1421718#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1381382" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1381382" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chelsey325"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1335359"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1335359.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chelsey325" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Under-The-Lemon-Tree-53379.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53379.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Under The Lemon Tree"title="Under The Lemon Tree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1381382ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1381382" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1335359">Chelsey325</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-25">07/25/21 13:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love rose scents and was excited for my husband to try this. An immediate NO. It smells like rose and BO to me. I’m not sure which note is throwing me off, but unfortunately not something that I like.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1381382"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1381382#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1374111" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1374111" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="paycrchf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/230344"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="paycrchf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Millesime-Imperial-466.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.466.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Millésime Impérial"title="Millésime Impérial"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1374111ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1374111" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/230344">paycrchf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-11">07/11/21 04:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I didn't know I would wear a rose-based fragrance until this one. Masculine and super wearable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1374111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1374111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1374031" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1374031" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amatuerfraghead"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347852"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1347852.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amatuerfraghead" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/L-Ombre-Dans-L-Eau-Eau-de-Parfum-49099.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49099.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L’Ombre Dans L’Eau Eau de Parfum"title="L’Ombre Dans L’Eau Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1374031ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1374031" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347852">amatuerfraghead</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-10">07/10/21 23:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Before i begin, i must state that i already own Rose 31 and bought the Duke blindly. If you dont tell me which is which, i would think i have smelled Rose 31, and i cant stress enough how similar they are. The only differences i can find, which i must dig my norse really close in order to find, is that the spice comes from pepper rather than cummins, and the duke is a tad sweeter. I get no gin in this. Otherwise, there is no discernible different, and that there is no point having them both in your collection. I myself prefer Rose 31 for better performance, but do yourself justice and get the one with the lower price. While the dog-head bottle cap is amazing, the label here is poorly made. Maybe they spent all the money on the cap and didnt spent enough on the label, which will peel off in no time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1374031"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1374031#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1366299" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1366299" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="penguinrabbit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="penguinrabbit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Fresh-Laundry-6763.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6763.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fresh Laundry"title="Fresh Laundry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1366299ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1366299" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583">penguinrabbit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-26">06/26/21 07:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Way too peppery. I like a lot of spicy masculine scents but this is just overpowering one note. I get a bit of leather but not much rose and the rose I get disappears quickly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1366299"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1366299#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1356600" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1356600" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="J350"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="J350" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1356600ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1356600" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660">J350</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-08">06/08/21 09:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As one have said in an earlier review, this smells like hairy sweaty balls and the longevity is very good. The rose is too weak and the pepper and gin are very prominent. There are other rose based perfume I'd rather own and wear. If you like gin, I suggest getting Juniper Sling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1356600"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1356600#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1349426" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1349426" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="redkettle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343348"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1343348.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="redkettle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1349426ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1349426" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343348">redkettle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-26">05/26/21 03:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This review is based on a sample from the official Penhaigons 'Portraits Scent Library'.<br />
<br />
Much Ado evokes thoughts of the Shakespearean play and the Elizabethan/early Stuart period that obsesses some people. Elizabeth I was a Tudor. The Tudors were Welsh and claimed the English throne through war. Elizabeth died childless and her English (and Welsh) throne was inherited by the King of Scotland, James VI. James became James I of England. As king of two countries, his political task was preventing hostility between his subjects. James' courtiers invented a concept of a 'United Kingdom' and this developed into 'Britishness' as the United Kingdom increased its world empire. Shakespeare created plays which helped Elizabeth and her Court build up the fantasy of 'England' and suppress the Welsh identity of Elizabeth and the Tudors. He then helped James and his Court invent the fantasy of the 'United Kingdom' and suppress the Scottish identity of James and the Stuarts. On these fantasy 'national identities' the bigger fantasy of 'Britishness' (which also appropriated and then disavowed all identities from across the Empire while valorising a supposedly unchanging unchangable 'Englishness') was constructed. In case you are wondering, England has not had an English monarch since before 1066. These issues of identity, sovereignity, nationhood are hot political topics today. Calling a perfume 'Much Ado' is knowingly stirring this pot. I call that risky.<br />
<br />
Just in case nationalism were not controversial enough for you, Much Ado is also a play that focuses on gender identity, the fluidity of gender, and the social conflicts, dangers, and comedy that gender issues can bring. <br />
<br />
And so to the fragrance - Much Ado opens with a blast of rose-scented vinegar and cedar-wood shavings. It then quickly cools to a salty, papery, peppery, vague, confused swirl of notes. I have two mental images - the first is of an Elizabethan pomander (a citrus fruit such as an orange or bergamot stuffed with cloves and other spices and carried about in the hand to be sniffed at for the fragrance and to protect the health - disease was thought at that time to be spread by inhaling foul odours thus inhaling sweet odours was a kind of 'vaccination'). But there is no citrus in this perfume (maybe some mouldy old orange peel in the waste basket with the cedar wood pencil shavings?) so it is a pomander without its fruit - just old spices then. The second mental image is of the British street food 'fish n chips' where hot fried potatoes and fish were liberally sprinkled with salt and malt vinegar and eaten from paper wrappings by the seaside and in other holiday locations. But in this perfume the chips are of cedar wood, the vinegar is made from roses, and the seasonings include sea salt and - I cannot identify the exact spices but something like - cloves, cumin, cinnamon? The impression of cold, salty seaside and dry, papery newsprint is quite strong. <br />
<br />
The marketing blurb suggests this perfume is about some kind of conflict between the desirable (to whom?) Duke and his indifferent (because?) Duchess. The hint is towards Virginia Woolf and 'Orlando' and gender-bending bed-hopping through the Ages. But what I get is not romance or plain sex but a confused olfactory portrait of 'England'. Much Ado evokes the nostalgic olfactory experiences of 'English' Elizabethan pomander or 'English' 1930s seaside holiday food but mixes them up together into an Elizabethan holiday or seaside pomander. I get the impression this fragrance pretends to say something but it over-reaches itself, has lost the plot, and just settles for a vague mess because the designer ran out of time and ideas before reaching any real conclusion. A confused mess is actually a pretty good portrait of both 'Englishness' and 'gender' in contemporary Britain. Maybe I am disappointed with this fragrance because it fails to resolve the contradictions. But if politicians and theorists and activists and everyone else cannot sort out our mess why should I expect a perfume to do so?<br />
<br />
Verdict: decent quality, uses the same old notes, breaks no new ground, feels generic although I cannot identify a perfume it reminds me of. Unisex. Not sexy - this Duke keeps his socks on. Long-lasting, low silage. It is worth sampling. Not sure it is worth a full bottle as it is just a 'work in progress'. Or, if you are intrigued by the politics of identity, gender and nationhood, this might be a fragrance to wear while you think through the enigma. It does not offer answers but at least it poses some questions. If you go to see Shakespeare at the theatre or go to one of those outside events where people dress up to re-enact Elizabethan times then this would be the ideal fragrance to wear. Unless you have some sort of season ticket, a sample will be enough for those uses.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1349426"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1349426#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1322967" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1322967" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ehsankasiri"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/993871"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.993871.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ehsankasiri" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1322967ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1322967" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/993871">ehsankasiri</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-10">04/10/21 09:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>یک رز بسیااااار با طرافت و با کیفیت<br />
ساقه تا گل<br />
برای طرفداران رز تازه و غیر گلابگون انتخاب بسیااار ارزشمندیست<br />
-----------<br />
Scent &amp; Quality: 10/10<br />
Longevity: 8/10<br />
Sillage: 7/10<br />
Creativity &amp; Uniqueness: 8/10<br />
Affordability: 2/10<br />
-----------<br />
Overall: 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1322967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1322967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1276965" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1276965" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sam Calone"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276375"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1276375.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sam Calone" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Bvlgari-Man-In-Black-26358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bvlgari Man In Black"title="Bvlgari Man In Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1276965ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1276965" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276375">Sam Calone</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-16">01/16/21 10:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favorite rose fragrances so far! A must try for all rose lovers. Very masculine and very unisex. I blind bought this and I'm so happy I did!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1276965"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1276965#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1274546" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1274546" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cheessey"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cheessey" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1274546ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1274546" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293732">Cheessey</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-11">01/11/21 21:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nice spring scent. The pepper and Gin are the most noticeable notes on me. However, the wood adds a nice twist which keeps it interesting. It does have a tendency to bring out allergies when applies and it makes me sneeze when I put it on. <br />
Overall, I like it a lot because it stands out, but not in a bad way. The spice is great during a warm spring day and makes me feel like I am outside even when sitting in front of a screen in the office. It is also one of my dog's favorite scents which makes the dog topper quite fitting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1274546"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1274546#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1258163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1258163" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="corinmelody"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/3294"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.3294.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="corinmelody" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Heures-d-Absence-59485.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59485.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Heures d'Absence"title="Heures d'Absence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1258163ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1258163" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/3294">corinmelody</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-08">12/08/20 01:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Daphne makes the best perfume. The first sniff of Rose 31 was so surprising and Tonka 25 was a love at first sniff. <br />
<br />
And now it's the Duke. <br />
<br />
It wasn't quite pleasant to my nose with gin among as its top notes, but after it dries down, a subtle, non-disturbing, non-flamboyant rose emerges, together with calming woody notes (only detected on my skin, not so much on the testing strips/ Penhaligons handkerchief), it becomes a magic moment.<br />
<br />
It smells very much like Rose 31 in the dry down, both subtle floral and mild woody. Even it is marketed to be a male fragrance, it's great for both genders. But if you ask me which one I prefer between this and Rose 31, I'd pick 31 to avoid the gin note and it's also less rosey.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1258163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1258163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1248197" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1248197" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RottigrlNYC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191473.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RottigrlNYC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1248197ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1248197" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); But that’s on my skin. Everyone is different</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1248197"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1248197#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1172244" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785">echo4kilo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-06">05/06/20 10:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Much Ado About The Duke is a really nice smelling fragrance. I'm a big fan of the rose note and this does it well. It opens up with a very strong floral/rose smell. Very strong. To the amount that at first I would say this is a feminine fragrance. After an hour the rose note has dissipated and the wood and pepper are what remains. Really nice and good longevity. I could still smell glimpses of it 8 hours later.<br />
<br />
Finished my sample. Sad. It is an extremely nice fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1172244"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1172244#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1168128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It looks like it's positioned as a male cologne but it seemed more like a traditional female perfume to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1129710"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1129710#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1057408" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1057408" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bbjr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/199261"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.199261.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bbjr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1057408ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1057408" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/199261">Bbjr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-05">05/05/19 15:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great stuff. Le Labo Rose 31 in its original formulation.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1057408"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1057408#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1047849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1047849" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="reubengod"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133418"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1133418.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="reubengod" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Acqua-di-Gio-Profondo-59532.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59532.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua di Giò Profondo"title="Acqua di Giò Profondo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1047849ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1047849" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133418">reubengod</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-04">04/04/19 09:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this. It's so comforting to wear and so unusual that it has quickly become my everyday signature scent - when people get close they realise that the fragrance is coming from me, not a room filler by any means, more of a fragrance aura</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1047849"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1047849#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1002862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1002862" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tinyhedgehog"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/960659"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.960659.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tinyhedgehog" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Reminiscence/Oud-Glacial-57361.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57361.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Glacial"title="Oud Glacial"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1002862ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1002862" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/960659">tinyhedgehog</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-21">11/21/18 06:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oooooh, what a surprise that perfume turned out to be. On paper I got a cold, crisp rose with animalic undertones - not bad, but not very interesting either. Then I sprayed it on my skin. Immediately I got a blast of piney, boozy, aromatic notes that are pretty obviously gin-inspired, followed by an immediate wave of cumin. After a handful of minutes, the perfume settled on my skin; the cumin became less obvious, the gin notes more balanced, and the rose started peaking through. Cumin, rose and juniper doesn't sound like a combination that should work, but somehow it really, really does: the rose acts like a bridge between the vegetal-bitter and sweaty-animalic facets of this perfume, but without losing its own floral identity. I can't tell if I'm pulling it off - you do need to be a certain type of person for this to really work on you, and I don't think I'm it - but I think as a perfume this is a resounding success.<br />
I find it interesting that the gin note seems to be mostly absent from other reviews; in my opinion they are what truly distinguishes this perfume from Le Labo Rose 31, and also justify the price difference between the two. I assume their unfolding is probably very dependent on your personal chemistry and the local weather, so definitely get a sample before buying to see if you'll get them or not.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="1002862"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=1002862#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent968192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc968192" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spumyland"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/189882"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.189882.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="spumyland" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maher-Olfactive/Santal-Auster-60618.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60618.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Auster"title="Santal Auster"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma968192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd968192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/189882">spumyland</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-08-03">08/03/18 06:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is difficult to describe ... The pepper is there and it feels good, <br />
the rose is there but it is unusual, sweet but not too much. The woody notes are firm, austere and sober. <br />
Because of a hangover I hate gin but it does not bother me here and it sounds good to give a fresh edge to the leather goods. As for the sex I changed my mind three times so in summary I think it is unisex.We are in August and on my skin dries quickly and accentuates dusty and masculine. On the other hand, the whistles I take at a distance are mostly animal , feminine, almost fruity. I saw the price, I would say that it is suitable for a couple's use. <br />
All in all it is versatile in quality and leaves a good memory. Nice portrait!<br />
 <br />
Suitable for day, evening, summer, winter, indoors, outdoors, elegant, sports tonic, etc.<br />
This has character!But I prefer others in this line.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="968192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=968192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent935111" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc935111" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wxmath"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1040946"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1040946.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wxmath" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Ani-54785.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54785.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ani"title="Ani"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma935111ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd935111" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1040946">wxmath</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-04-21">04/21/18 12:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rose and pepper for sure but low longevity and sillage. Not bottle worthy for me as I have other rose scents that are better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="935111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=935111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent907217" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc907217" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tomelise"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066094"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1066094.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tomelise" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gallagher-Fragrances/Baklava-68363.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68363.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baklava"title="Baklava"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma907217ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd907217" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066094">Tomelise</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-02">02/02/18 07:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you are looking for an unusual rose fragrance, that's it! Need to admit I don't like Penhaligon`s at all. This one, however, is  real beauty. Rose, heady sexy rose! With nothing waxy or overly balsamic. It's spicy, cool with heady alcohol touch. First time I've tested it I smelled something boozy and that was quite unexpected, so I immediately went on fragrantica to see the notes and yes!Gin is there. Cool, a bit piny and seducing. Love it! And it is very special indeed. I honestly can't think of any other rose scent that would be as fresh and elegant but at the same time as sexy as this one!Oh, and absolutely unisex. I find that men and women would love to smell it of opposite sex. I am judging a sample. The projection is quite moderate. It's noticeable but not too much. Best Penhaligon for me:)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="907217"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=907217#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent904247" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc904247" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sophywt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1163.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sophywt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Spicebomb-13857.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13857.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spicebomb"title="Spicebomb"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma904247ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd904247" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163">sophywt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-01-24">01/24/18 21:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Much Ado About The Duke is an interesting rose scent.<br />
<br />
I tested it on my wrist yesterday and was a bit disappointed because of the initial peppery note(more like cumin, and cumin always smells ampit to my nose, sadly). It reminds me of Rose Poivree from The Different Company, lighter though. Anyway, not my cup of tea, and I could only comfort myself that my money ($200+) was not a waste because the bottle looks great and forget all about the scent...<br />
<br />
And 10 min later, I got a whiff of airy floral scent. It's not typical rose, more like a combination of various light florals with rose as main actor, a little powdery, but not loud. At first I thought someone was applying rose hand cream, then I remembered The Duke. It was lovely if you kept certain distance, and once you got close, it becames a cumin beast. Tested it on my friend, the same - I could smell nice floral scents when she walked by, once I got sniff her wrist, not lovely anymore.<br />
<br />
It suprises me that the Duke is marketed as male scent, I admit that I have a hard time to imagine what kind of man or in what kind of occassion this scent would suit.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40713"comment_id="904247"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Much-Ado-About-The-Duke-40713.html?ccid=904247#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent901518" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc896034" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Clive Brass"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1110074"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1110074.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Clive Brass" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma896034ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd896034" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);
